title: encountered ambiguity selecting `T` during codegen, presuming due to overflow or prior type error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #[macro_use] extern crate rocket; use rocket::response::stream::TextStream; use rocket::tokio::time::{self, Duration}; /// Produce an infinite series of `"hello"`s, one per second. #[get("/infinite-hellos")] fn hello() -> TextStream![&'static str] { TextStream! { let mut interval = time::interval(Duration::from_secs(1)); loop { yield "hello"; interval.tick().await; } } } #[launch] fn rocket() -> _ { rocket::build().mount("/", routes![hello]) } ``` ### Meta encountered this while trying to run an example int he Rocket documentation. bug only exists on nightly. im using `rocket = "0.5.0-rc.1"` `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0-nightly (e7aca8959 2022-02-09) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc ``` ### Error output ``` D:\coding\Rust\playground>cargo run Compiling rocket v0.5.0-rc.1 error: internal compiler error: encountered ambiguity selecting `Binder(> as std::convert::From>>, [])` during codegen, presuming due to overflow or prior type error | = note: delayed at compiler\rustc_trait_selection\src\traits\codegen.rs:54:32 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:1176:13 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ffdead57d30 - ::fmt::hd9a1cc8c1ba9a6ad 1: 0x7ffdead8779a - core::fmt::write::h346f1639821b09ca 2: 0x7ffdead49119 - ::fmt::h6ed49041e1bde020 3: 0x7ffdead5b4a2 - std::panicking::default_hook::hb86a255b5ae1a1b5 4: 0x7ffdead5b063 - std::panicking::default_hook::hb86a255b5ae1a1b5 5: 0x7ffd9cc8ca76 - ::fmt 6: 0x7ffdead5bdd2 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h0b2277542f9fb56f 7: 0x7ffdead5bb1d - ::get::h26c29f56be126ea1 8: 0x7ffdead58687 - ::fmt::hd9a1cc8c1ba9a6ad 9: 0x7ffdead5b799 - rust_begin_unwind 10: 0x7ffdeadba985 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::ha2acae3cf1e02ef3 11: 0x7ffda13f6167 - ::fmt 12: 0x7ffda13f2e38 - ::delay_as_bug 13: 0x7ffda13ee342 - ::drop 14: 0x7ffd9cc2fde4 - ::fmt 15: 0x7ffd9cc4bec7 - ::fmt 16: 0x7ffd9cc2586d - ::fmt 17: 0x7ffd9cc29b20 - ::fmt 18: 0x7ffd9cc1ef0a - ::set_interest 19: 0x7ffd9cbff7c3 - ::set_interest 20: 0x7ffd9cca2fa8 - rustc_driver[62efd2c0abe8586f]::pretty::print_after_hir_lowering 21: 0x7ffdead6c73c - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::h1745d7e554009389 22: 0x7ffe55e37034 - BaseThreadInitThunk 23: 0x7ffe56582651 - RtlUserThreadStart error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.60.0-nightly (e7aca8959 2022-02-09) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `rocket` ```
Backtrace

``` included in error output section ```
